title: Valentine prompt single-page UI with evasive No and celebratory meme

requirements.summary: Render a single-page Valentine prompt asking “Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?” with exactly two buttons: Yes and No.
acceptanceCriteria: Page contains one primary prompt: "Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?" (English text).
Exactly two visible buttons are present: "Yes" and "No".
No additional app flows/pages/features beyond this interaction.

file_operations.description: Create the single-screen App that renders the Valentine prompt interaction (no routing).

Implement the prompt UI with exactly two actions (Yes/No). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) to provide consistent structure and button styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the No button evasive on hover and touch so it repositions within the viewport/container without overlapping the Yes button.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor onto/over the "No" button causes it to reposition immediately.
On touch devices (iPad/Chrome): attempting to tap/press the "No" button triggers repositioning (e.g., on pointerdown/touchstart) before a click can register.
The "No" button never becomes unclickably off-screen; it remains fully visible after each move.
The "No" button does not cover or overlap the "Yes" button after repositioning.

file_operations.description: Add evasive positioning logic for the No button using measured container/button bounds: on mouse enter and on pointer/touch start, compute a new on-screen position that stays fully within the visible container/viewport and does not overlap the Yes button.

requirements.summary: On Yes click/tap, transition to a celebratory result view showing the meme image with the text “Good choice❤❤❤”.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping "Yes" shows a meme image with the exact text "Good choice❤❤❤" visible on the image.
After clicking "Yes", the user is no longer presented with both "Yes" and "No" choices (the UI transitions to the result state).

file_operations.description: Add component state to swap from the decision UI (prompt + two buttons) to a result view when Yes is clicked/tapped, rendering the required meme image as the primary content.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive romantic pink/white theme with a clean responsive layout optimized for iPad Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: Overall styling is pink/white romantic-themed (background, buttons, typography) and visually consistent.
Layout is responsive and remains readable and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome (no clipped prompt/buttons).
Animations/transitions (if any) remain smooth and do not block interaction.

file_operations.description: Create global styles to establish the romantic pink/white theme (background, typography, and sensible defaults) while remaining compatible with the existing Tailwind setup.

Apply responsive layout classes and spacing for iPad-sized viewports (centered content, readable prompt sizing, comfortable button sizes, and non-blocking transitions). Use shadcn-ui components where helpful for consistent visual hierarchy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated meme image as a static frontend asset and render it directly without backend calls.
acceptanceCriteria: A generated image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filename.
The "Yes" result view loads and displays the image via a static path from the frontend build (no backend calls required).

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset file (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png) under the required generated assets directory.
Reference and render the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png in the Yes result view (no backend capability and no runtime image generation).
